medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain began less than 24 hours prior to presenting, starting at 10 PM, two hours after eating dinner. The pain is described as sharp, stabbing, and constant. The patient has also experienced chills and nausea but denies having a fever.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Atrial septal defect (ASD), cerebrovascular accident (CVA) with left sided deficit, status post umbilical hernia repair, status post left inguinal hernia repair.
medical_history.family_history: Both parents have a history of cerebrovascular accident (CVA).
